description: Amazon CloudWatch enables you to publish, monitor, and manage various metrics, as well as configure alarm actions based on data from metrics.

blocks.name: listMetrics
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to retrive list the specified metrics.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: The region for endpoint. See README for all possible values.

args.name: dimensions
args.info: Optional: Array of objects. The dimensions to filter against. Maximum number of 10 items. See README for more details.

args.name: metricName
args.info: Optional: The name of the metric to filter against. Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 255.

args.name: namespace
args.info: Optional: The namespace to filter against. Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 255. Pattern: [^:].*

args.name: nextToken
args.info: Optional: The token returned by a previous call to indicate that there is more data available.

blocks.name: getMetricStatistics
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to gets statistics for the specified metric.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: The region for endpoint. See README for all possible values.

args.name: dimensions
args.info: Optional: Array of objects. The dimensions. CloudWatch treats each unique combination of dimensions as a separate metric. You can't retrieve statistics using combinations of dimensions that were not specially published. You must specify the same dimensions that were used when the metrics were created. See README for more details.

args.name: endTime
args.info: Required: The time stamp that determines the last data point to return. The value specified is exclusive; results will include data points up to the specified time stamp. The time stamp must be in ISO 8601 UTC format (for example, 2016-10-10T23:00:00Z).

args.name: extendedStatistics
args.info: Optional: Array of strings. The percentile statistics. Specify values between p0.0 and p100. Array Members: Minimum number of 1 item. Maximum number of 10 items. Pattern: p(\d{1,2}(\.\d{0,2})?|100).

args.name: metricName
args.info: Required: The name of the metric, with or without spaces. Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 255.

args.name: namespace
args.info: Required: The namespace of the metric, with or without spaces. Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 255. Pattern: [^:].*

args.name: period
args.info: Required: The granularity, in seconds, of the returned data points. A period can be as short as one minute (60 seconds) and must be a multiple of 60. The default value is 60. See README for more details.

args.name: startTime
args.info: Required: The time stamp that determines the first data point to return. Note that start times are evaluated relative to the time that CloudWatch receives the request. The value specified is inclusive; results include data points with the specified time stamp. The time stamp must be in ISO 8601 UTC format (for example, 2016-10-03T23:00:00Z).

args.name: statistics
args.info: Optional: Array of strings. The metric statistics, other than percentile. For percentile statistics, use ExtendedStatistic. Minimum number of 1 item. Maximum number of 5 items. Valid Values: SampleCount | Average | Sum | Minimum | Maximum

args.name: unit
args.info: Optional: The unit for a given metric. Metrics may be reported in multiple units. Not supplying a unit results in all units being returned. If the metric only ever reports one unit, specifying a unit has no effect. Valid Values: Seconds | Microseconds | Milliseconds | Bytes | Kilobytes | Megabytes | Gigabytes | Terabytes | Bits | Kilobits | Megabits | Gigabits | Terabits | Percent | Count | Bytes/Second | Kilobytes/Second | Megabytes/Second | Gigabytes/Second | Terabytes/Second | Bits/Second | Kilobits/Second | Megabits/Second | Gigabits/Second | Terabits/Second | Count/Second | None

blocks.name: putMetricAlarm
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to creates or updates an alarm and associates it with the specified metric.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: The region for endpoint. See README for all possible values.

args.name: actionsEnabled
args.info: Optional: Indicates whether actions should be executed during any changes to the alarm state. True || false

args.name: alarmActions
args.info: Optional: Array of strings. The actions to execute when this alarm transitions to the ALARM state from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource Name (ARN). See README for more details.

args.name: alarmDescription
args.info: Optional: The description for the alarm. Minimum length of 0. Maximum length of 1024.

args.name: alarmName
args.info: Required: The name for the alarm. This name must be unique within the AWS account. Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 255.

args.name: comparisonOperator
args.info: Required: The arithmetic operation to use when comparing the specified statistic and threshold. The specified statistic value is used as the first operand. Valid Values: GreaterThanOrEqualToThreshold | GreaterThanThreshold | LessThanThreshold | LessThanOrEqualToThreshold

args.name: dimensions
args.info: Optional: Array of objects. The dimensions for the metric associated with the alarm. See README for more details.

args.name: evaluationPeriods
args.info: Required: The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified threshold. Minimum value of 1.

args.name: extendedStatistic
args.info: Optional: The percentile statistic for the metric associated with the alarm. Specify a value between p0.0 and p100. Pattern: p(\d{1,2}(\.\d{0,2})?|100)

args.name: insufficientDataActions
args.info: Optional: Array of strings. Maximum number of 5 items. Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 1024. Valid Values: arn:aws:automate:region:ec2:stop | arn:aws:automate:region:ec2:terminate | arn:aws:automate:region:ec2:recover. See README for more deatails.

args.name: metricName
args.info: Required: The name for the metric associated with the alarm. Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 255.

args.name: namespace
args.info: Required: The namespace for the metric associated with the alarm. Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 255. Pattern: [^:].*

args.name: OKActions
args.info: Optional: The actions to execute when this alarm transitions to an OK state from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource Name (ARN). Maximum number of 5 items. Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 1024. Valid Values: arn:aws:automate:region:ec2:stop | arn:aws:automate:region:ec2:terminate | arn:aws:automate:region:ec2:recover. See README for more details.

args.name: period
args.info: Required: The period, in seconds, over which the specified statistic is applied. Minimum value of 60.

args.name: statistic
args.info: Optional: The statistic for the metric associated with the alarm, other than percentile. For percentile statistics, use ExtendedStatistic. Valid Values: SampleCount | Average | Sum | Minimum | Maximum

args.name: threshold
args.info: Required: The value against which the specified statistic is compared.

args.name: unit
args.info: Optional: The unit of measure for the statistic. Valid Values: Seconds | Microseconds | Milliseconds | Bytes | Kilobytes | Megabytes | Gigabytes | Terabytes | Bits | Kilobits | Megabits | Gigabits | Terabits | Percent | Count | Bytes/Second | Kilobytes/Second | Megabytes/Second | Gigabytes/Second | Terabytes/Second | Bits/Second | Kilobits/Second | Megabits/Second | Gigabits/Second | Terabits/Second | Count/Second | None

blocks.name: putMetricData
blocks.description: Publishes metric data points to Amazon CloudWatch. Amazon CloudWatch associates the data points with the specified metric. If the specified metric does not exist, Amazon CloudWatch creates the metric.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: The region for endpoint. See README for all possible values.

args.name: dimensions
args.info: Optional: Array of objects. The dimensions associated with the metric. Maximum number of 10 items. See README for more details.

args.name: metricName
args.info: Required: The name of the metric. Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 255.

args.name: statisticValues
args.info: Optional: Json object. The statistical values for the metric. See README for more details.

args.name: timestamp
args.info: Optional: The time the metric data was received, expressed as the number of milliseconds since Jan 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC.

args.name: unit
args.info: Optional: The unit of the metric. Valid Values: Seconds | Microseconds | Milliseconds | Bytes | Kilobytes | Megabytes | Gigabytes | Terabytes | Bits | Kilobits | Megabits | Gigabits | Terabits | Percent | Count | Bytes/Second | Kilobytes/Second | Megabytes/Second | Gigabytes/Second | Terabytes/Second | Bits/Second | Kilobits/Second | Megabits/Second | Gigabits/Second | Terabits/Second | Count/Second | None

args.name: value
args.info: Optional: The value for the metric. Values must be in the range of 8.515920e-109 to 1.174271e+108 (Base 10) or 2e-360 to 2e360 (Base 2). In addition, special values (for example, NaN, +Infinity, -Infinity) are not supported.

args.name: namespace
args.info: Required: The namespace for the metric data. You cannot specify a namespace that begins with "AWS/". Namespaces that begin with "AWS/" are reserved for use by Amazon Web Services products. Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 255. Pattern: [^:].*

blocks.name: setAlarmState
blocks.description: Temporarily sets the state of an alarm for testing purposes. When the updated state differs from the previous value, the action configured for the appropriate state is invoked.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: The region for endpoint. See README for all possible values.

args.name: alarmName
args.info: Required: The name for the alarm. This name must be unique within the AWS account. The maximum length is 255 characters.

args.name: stateReason
args.info: Required: The reason that this alarm is set to this specific state, in text format.

args.name: stateReasonData
args.info: Optional: The reason that this alarm is set to this specific state, in JSON format.

args.name: stateValue
args.info: Optional: The value of the state. Valid Values: OK | ALARM | INSUFFICIENT_DATA

blocks.name: deleteAlarms
blocks.description: Deletes the specified alarms. In the event of an error, no alarms are deleted.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: The region for endpoint. See README for all possible values.

args.name: alarmNames
args.info: Required: Array of strings. The alarms to be deleted. Members: Maximum number of 100 items.

blocks.name: describeAlarmHistory
blocks.description: Retrieves the history for the specified alarm. You can filter the results by date range or item type. If an alarm name is not specified, the histories for all alarms are returned.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: The region for endpoint. See README for all possible values.

args.name: alarmName
args.info: Optional: The name of the alarm. Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 255.

args.name: endDate
args.info: Optional: The ending date to retrieve alarm history. Timestamp (string|DateTime or anything parsable by strtotime).

args.name: historyItemType
args.info: Optional: The type of alarm histories to retrieve. Valid Values: ConfigurationUpdate | StateUpdate | Action

args.name: maxRecords
args.info: Optional: The maximum number of alarm history records to retrieve. Minimum value of 1. Maximum value of 100.

args.name: nextToken
args.info: Optional: The token returned by a previous call to indicate that there is more data available.

args.name: startDate
args.info: Optional: The starting date to retrieve alarm history. Timestamp (string|DateTime or anything parsable by strtotime).

blocks.name: describeAlarms
blocks.description: Retrieves the specified alarms. If no alarms are specified, all alarms are returned. Alarms can be retrieved by using only a prefix for the alarm name, the alarm state, or a prefix for any action.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: The region for endpoint. See README for all possible values.

args.name: actionPrefix
args.info: Optional: The action name prefix. Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 1024.

args.name: alarmNamePrefix
args.info: Optional: The alarm name prefix. You cannot specify AlarmNames if this parameter is specified.

args.name: AlarmNames
args.info: Optional: Array of strings. The names of the alarms. Members: Maximum number of 100 items. See README for more details.

args.name: maxRecords
args.info: Optional: The maximum number of alarm descriptions to retrieve. Minimum value of 1. Maximum value of 100.

args.name: nextToken
args.info: Optional: The token returned by a previous call to indicate that there is more data available.

args.name: stateValue
args.info: Optional: The state value to be used in matching alarms. Valid Values: OK | ALARM | INSUFFICIENT_DATA

blocks.name: describeAlarmsForMetric
blocks.description: Retrieves the alarms for the specified metric. Specify a statistic, period, or unit to filter the results.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: The region for endpoint. See README for all possible values.

args.name: dimensions
args.info: Optional: Array of objects. The dimensions associated with the metric. If the metric has any associated dimensions, you must specify them in order for the call to succeed. Members: Maximum number of 10 items. See README for more details.

args.name: extendedStatistic
args.info: Optional: The percentile statistic for the metric. Specify a value between p0.0 and p100. Pattern: p(\d{1,2}(\.\d{0,2})?|100)

args.name: metricName
args.info: Required: The name of the metric. Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 255.

args.name: namespace
args.info: Required: The namespace of the metric. Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 255. Pattern: [^:].*

args.name: period
args.info: Optional: The period, in seconds, over which the statistic is applied. Minimum value of 60.

args.name: statistic
args.info: Optional: The statistic for the metric, other than percentiles. For percentile statistics, use ExtendedStatistics. Valid Values: SampleCount | Average | Sum | Minimum | Maximum

args.name: unit
args.info: Optional: The unit for the metric. Valid Values: Seconds | Microseconds | Milliseconds | Bytes | Kilobytes | Megabytes | Gigabytes | Terabytes | Bits | Kilobits | Megabits | Gigabits | Terabits | Percent | Count | Bytes/Second | Kilobytes/Second | Megabytes/Second | Gigabytes/Second | Terabytes/Second | Bits/Second | Kilobits/Second | Megabits/Second | Gigabits/Second | Terabits/Second | Count/Second | None

blocks.name: disableAlarmActions
blocks.description: Disables the actions for the specified alarms. When an alarm's actions are disabled, the alarm actions do not execute when the alarm state changes.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: The region for endpoint. See README for all possible values.

args.name: alarmNames
args.info: Required: Array of strings. The names of the alarms. Members: Maximum number of 100 items. See README for more details.

blocks.name: enableAlarmActions
blocks.description: Enables the actions for the specified alarms.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: The region for endpoint. See README for all possible values.

args.name: alarmNames
args.info: Required: Array of strings. The names of the alarms. Members: Maximum number of 100 items. See README for more details.
